title: Senior IT Support Specialist APAC
company: VANTAGE DATA CENTERS APAC PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Vantage Data Centres
Vantage Data Centres powers, cools, protects and connects the technology of the world’s well-known hyperscalers, cloud providers and large enterprises. Developing and operating across six markets in North America and five markets in Europe, Vantage has evolved data centre design in innovative ways to deliver dramatic gains in reliability, efficiency and sustainability in flexible environments that can scale as quickly as the market demands.
Our global business is growing quickly. In EMEA, we have sites in the UK, Ireland, Luxembourg, Germany, Switzerland, Poland and South Africa – with many more national and international sites to follow. This is a fantastic time to join Vantage and be part of our collective growth journey.
Information Technology Department
The Technology & Systems Department for Vantage Data Centres is very hands on. In most cases, we specify, purchase, configure and maintain all networking and server hardware. We also work closely with partner VARs to learn about the latest technology changes so we can make informed purchase decisions. The IT department is always looking for ways to strike the best balance between technology, performance and cost.
Vantage Technology & Systems also participates in designing each of our new data centre building’s networking infrastructure, including but not limited to: diverse pathways connecting to carriers, meet-me room (MMR) hosting (rack, cabs, ladders, cross connect panels…), wireless AP coverage, etc. If you like getting your hands dirty and helping to design, build and maintain IT infrastructure in a modern data centre, then come work at Vantage. We’re expanding with many new builds!
Essential Job Functions
To assist with updating and maintaining the ticketing system based on functional and business requirements.
To provide telephone, email and field support to internal customers and colleagues providing an excellent level of service to meet Vantage’s SLA. Calls must be logged, prioritised and actioned via the IT ticket system.
To ensure that all associated tickets are updated in a timely manner so that the status of logged calls can be monitored, and problem reporting can be done effectively.
To be able to identify trends and escalate them to other global team members as well as be proactive in identifying areas for improvement.
Ability to identify and translate common escalated issues into employee self-service guide and platform.
To assist in the development of the Service Desk procedures and creation of material knowledge base articles
To undertake project work assigned by management, and provide regular weekly/monthly reports as agreed, ensuring that the work is done to agreed standards and that any problems are communicated in a timely manner.
To undertake the installation, maintenance and decommissioning of computer hardware, software and peripherals ensuring that this is done to agreed procedures and standards and that all relevant documentation is maintained.
Frequent contact with employees at all levels of the organization; frequent external contact with vendors
To act as an escalation point for 1st and 2nd line support and onward link between our internal customers and Global IT department
Assist in maintaining Vantages IT assets provisioning, decommissioning to disposal aligned to the global standards
Support all Site IT equipment (with global support if required) within local and regional offices inclusive of AV equipment, wireless access points, IDF room and scheduled power maintenance outage.
Work with external vendors to diagnose, troubleshoot, fix/repair technical issues with software and hardware.
Assist in the care and maintenance of computing, network and office equipment.
Deploy, install, and configure OS and software applications.
Provide new or regular orientation and guidance to users on how to operate new software, collaboration tools, and computer equipment as per the global process
Properly escalate unresolved daily issues to appropriate teams
Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot basic technical issues
Job Requirements
Bachelor of Science degree or equivalent experience preferred
Hands-on experience working with Windows, Linux & OSX on global image.
Ability to support Active Directory, Azure and Office 365.
Experience working with Android and IOS phones
Excellent English written and oral communication skills.
Some Travel is expected in the region.
4-6 years’ experience working in a global corporate end users/service desk environment in a matrix reporting environment support global users.
Familiarity with remote desktop applications and help desk software
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Strong prioritisation and organisation skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks at once  including office projects.
Ability to manage regional vendors for support and maintenance in line with global procurement, support and maintenance standards and agreements.
Ability to provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbal
Ability to support global users remotely.
Ability to lift 25Lbs (Setting up workstations/Monitors)
Experience working with ServiceNow platform is required.
Work under limited supervision, both independently and within a team environment.
Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple projects.
Excellent customer service skills.
Good understanding of applications, computers, mobile devices and other tech products working within an ITIL environment and hands-on experience dealing with on Incident, Request, Change and problem management.  Preferably holding a current qualification of at least ITILv3
Technical qualifications such as Comptia A+, Network + , Microsoft certification would be advantageous.
Experience of Agile methodologies would an advantage.
Vantage Data Centres is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Desktop Support Coordinator
company_info: Diebold Nixdorf is a world leader in enabling connected commerce for million of consumers each day across the financial and retail industries. Its software-defined solutions bridge the physical and digital worlds of cash and consumers transactions conveniently, securely and efficiently. As an innovation partner for nearly all of the world's top 100 financial institutions and a majority of the top 25 global retailers, Diebold Nixdorf delivers unparalleled services and technology that are essential to evolve in an "always on" and changing consumer landscape. Diebold Nixdorf has a presence in more than 130 countries with approximately 25,000 employees worldwide. The organization maintains corporate offices in North Canton, Ohio, USA and Paderborn, Germany. Visit www.DieboldNixdorf.com for more information.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview
Works with management to determine IT objectives to improve business outcomes and user experiences. Provides day-to-day technical support for team members and system users of network infrastructure and internal desktop systems. Installs, configures and troubleshoots desktop systems, workstations, servers and network issues. Maintains passwords, data integrity and file system security for the desktop environment. Recommends hardware and software solutions, including new equipment acquisitions, software and upgrades. May conduct training to help computer users understand and optimize basic and specialized applications.

Responsibilities
· Provides day-to-day IT operations supports and services to end users
· Analyzes IT requirements and provides advice on the use of IT devices
· Gains familiarity with Desktop Support concepts, practices and methodologies.
· With guidance, learns to perform Desktop Support duties, including:
o Installing and configuring basic workstation hardware and software,
o Ensuring system connectivity,
o Providing first-line user support,
o Troubleshooting hardware, software and connectivity issues,
o Assisting with installation and update of anti-virus software and with decontamination of infected systems,
o Assisting with user moves, including de-installation and re-installation,
o Assisting with desktop, laptop and printer break-fix services,
o Gathering and recording systems inventory data.
o Engages with printers, mobile/office phones and other office infrastructure management
o Provisions accounts for new users and de-provisions for departing employees
o Supports team projects within defined area of responsibility
o Ensures equipment/system/asset inventory is maintained as required
o Supports some IT infrastructure as per required scope of the team
o Provides IT supports on PC hardware, software, and applications with remote diagnosis, problem determination, and resolution with
o Manages computer life cycle, procurement, and distribution for users including new hires
· Learns and complies with the company’s desktop, peripheral and related connectivity and security policies and procedures.
· Trains employees in workstation and IT related device usages
· Learns how actions impact SLAs.
· Assists with special projects as assigned.

Qualifications
Minimum 3 years of IT support experiences
A bachelor's degree in a computer discipline or relevant certification
Proven working experience as IT support specialist/analyst
Good experience with IT ticketing and report management tools
Good written and oral English communication skills
Familiar with a range of software and hardware
Good problem-solving skills, positive attitudes, and strong service mind
Preferred Qualifications
Some knowledge and experiences on IT Service Management or ITIL
Experiences working in a multi-cultural environment is a plus.

Why should you join Diebold Nixdorf?
Brightest minds + technology and innovation + business transformation The people of Diebold Nixdorf are 23,000+ teammates of diverse talents and expertise in more than 130 countries, harnessing future technologies to deliver personalized, secure consumer experiences that connect people to commerce. Our culture is fueled by our values of collaboration, decisiveness, urgency, willingness to change, and accountability.


–Diebold Nixdorf is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


** To all recruitment agencies: Diebold Nixdorf does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Diebold Nixdorf employees or any other organization location. Diebold Nixdorf is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes**

title: IT Support
company_info: Established in May 2000, Frontier Force Technology Pte Ltd comprises a dynamic tem from different areas of IT specialisation. We cover the full IT spectrum from networking, IT security solutions and proprietary software development to e-Business consultation and IT outsourcing and project management.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated IT Support Specialist to join our team. The IT Support Specialist will be responsible for providing technical assistance and support to EUC users and ensuring the smooth operation. The ideal candidate should possess a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a customer-focused attitude. This is a field support role.
Responsibilities:
Helpdesk Support: Respond to IT support requests from end users, either in person, via phone, or through the ticketing system. Troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues, and resolve problems in a timely manner.
Hardware and Software Setup: Assist with the installation, configuration, and deployment of computer systems, laptops, printers, software applications, and other IT equipment.
User Account Management: Manage user accounts, permissions, and access rights in various systems and applications. Ensure user onboarding and offboarding processes are executed accurately and efficiently.
Network Support: Troubleshoot network connectivity issues and work with the Network team to maintain a stable and secure network environment. To provide smart hand support for basic network devices installation and deployment.
IT Infrastructure Maintenance: Perform routine maintenance tasks on computer systems, servers, and other IT equipment. Keep hardware and software up to date with the latest patches and updates.

title: IT User Support Specialist
company_info: AVALOQ SOURCING ASIA PACIFIC (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. Avaloq is a value driven, fast-paced financial technology and services company and we are committed to developing the banking solutions of tomorrow. By joining Avaloq, you’ll become a key part of our effort to power the digital transformation of the financial services industry. Our ambition is big and bold – to provide full end-to-end digital solutions by combining our leading efficiency with a flexible, responsible digital user experience. Headquartered in Zurich, Avaloq has over 2,000 employees globally. More information is available at www.avaloq.com
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company Description
Founded and headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq is continuously expanding its global footprint with around 2,500 colleagues in 10 countries, and more than 160 clients in 35 countries. We are an industry-leading provider of wealth management technology and services for financial institutions around the world, including private banks and wealth managers, investment managers, as well as retail and neo banks. Our research led approach and continual innovation is powered by the passion and creativity of our colleagues.
We are always looking for talented people to join us on our mission to orchestrate the financial ecosystem and democratize access to wealth management. Avaloq offers the opportunity to work closely with some of the world’s leading financial institutions as we jointly develop and shape careers. Championing a collaborative, supportive and flexible work environment empowers our colleagues to reach their full potential.
Job Description
Your team
To support the Global IT User Support team, we are looking for a committed and skilled IT User Support Specialist. Due to our internationalization strategy, the User Support team must cover some other global locations remotely. Therefore, we are looking for a competent, responsible and independent person who helps us make this Global IT User Support Team a success. This requires close cooperation with all IT team members and users worldwide. You will be part of a warm, friendly and welcoming culture within the Singapore Office, so we expect you to be equally warm and welcoming.

Your key tasks
Solve the problems encountered by the users
1st and 2nd level support.
Recording, dispatching, carrying out progressive incident analysis, and resolving incidents.
Supporting internal users via tickets, phone, remotely, and on-site assistance.
Document systems, procedures, and processes
Handle IT service requests and manage request fulfillment process
Be responsible for the management of end-user assets and devices
Qualifications
Successfully completed IT education or comparable qualification
Experience in 1st and 2nd level support
Service oriented team player
Experience with various Microsoft Windows client and server operating systems
Experience with Microsoft 365 products (Office365, SharePoint, Teams, Exchange Online, etc.)
Knowledge about video conferencing, and ad hoc support for VC meetings
Working experience in a global context is a plus
Understanding of ITIL Incident Management best practices
It would be a real bonus if you have
Service oriented mentality
High sense of initiative
Passion to learn
Structured and goal-oriented working method
Distinctive organizational skills and process-oriented thinking
Additional information
We realize that managing work life balance is a challenge we all face in our daily lives and in order to support with this we are pleased to offer hybrid and flexible working for most of our Avaloqers to maintain work life balance and still continue our fantastic Avaloq culture in our global offices.
In Avaloq we are proud to embrace diversity and understand the success of our business is built on the power of different opinions, we are whole heartedly committed to fostering an equal opportunity environment and inclusive culture where you can be your true authentic self.
We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other fantastic traits that make us all unique, we have done our best to write this advert in an inclusive and neutral way.
Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations.

Please only apply online - https://smrtr.io/fyKz8, preferably with pdf documents.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB OBJECTIVE / PURPOSE:
To assist the System Engineer in the following, but not limited to, areas:
o Provide technical support to all end users.
o Provide onsite technical support for designated clients and locations.
o Maintenance of all hardware and software assets managed by the IT department.
o Daily management of the IT Department.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND AUTHORITIES:
Computer (End User) Administration
o Setup and configuration of new personal computers.
o Re-setup and configuration of existing personal computers.
o Installation of BIOS updates for all personal computers which cannot be automated via the network management tools.
o Setup of Management Approved Computer Peripherals (Managed Peripherals) such as printers, scanners, name-card readers etc, on end user computers.
o Maintenance of computer resources such as hard disk, operating system etc.
o To report all defective computers or components to the supervisor for replacement.
Software (End User) Administration
o Installation of Management Approved Software (Managed Software).
o Un-installation of expired or unauthorised software.
o Installation of upgrades/patches for all Managed Software which cannot be automated via the network management tools.
Network (End User) Administration
o Setup and configuration of network and email accounts for end users.
o Management of end user network accounts such as changing of passwords, updating of personal profiles and access rights etc.
o Ensure that end users adhere to regulations and guidelines as stated in all IT policies in their daily work routines.
o Report all violations of regulations as stated in all IT policies to the supervisor and/or the immediate supervisor of the offending users.
Technical Support (End User)
o Provide remote and onsite support for all technical issues originating from end user computers.
o Provide remote and onsite support for all technical issues originating from all Managed Software installed on end user computers.
o Provide 1st level remote and onsite support for all technical issues originating from all in-housed developed applications, used by end users.
o Provide onsite support for all technical issues originating from Managed Peripherals on end user computers or in common areas.
o Provide remote and onsite support for end users who are experiencing difficulties in accessing computer or network resources.
o Provide onsite support for all technical issues originating from end users of designated client locations.
Call Centre Administration & Support
o Provide support for all technical issues originating from the end user equipments such as CallMasters and headsets.
o Perform basic configurations for new and existing call centre services, inclusive and not limited to the following:
· VDN
· Vector
· Hunt Group
· Station
· Agent ID
· Audix Voicemail
o Perform administrative duties for the Voice Logger such as cleaning of tape drive, changing of new tapes etc to ensure smooth operation for the recordings of live calls.
o Provide administrative support to end users who require the changing of tapes for listening of archived call recordings.
Daily Administrative Duties
o Preparing and updating of technical documentations as designated by the supervisor.
o Assist in all scheduled or ad-hoc maintenance duties as designated by the supervisor.
o Assist in the tracking of all hardware and software assets managed by the department.
o Participate in evaluation of new technologies as designated by the supervisor.
o Performing of other IT-related duties as assigned by the supervisor or the manager.

REQUIREMENTS:
o *IT-related Diploma or equivalent/professional qualification in Information Technology.
o *1 - 2 year’s experiences or fresh graduates.

title: Regional IT Support Specialist

Associated with Spruson & Ferguson, Australia, the firm offers a comprehensive range of services relating to patents, designs and trade marks to domestic, regional and international clients. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Due to continued growth, an exciting contract opportunity now exists to join a highly experienced, collaborative and outcomes focused Asia-Pacific IT team working closely with the helpdesk and applications team, end users and stakeholders across the region.

We are seeking a Regional IT Support Specialist to join our Infrastructure Team to manage the day to day operations of our network and infrastructure, as well as level two help desk support and project related tasks. The scope includes all infrastructure used by our regional offices, such as networks, servers, databases, devices, user desktops/laptops, virtualisation, phone system, email, etc.
This role will be based in Singapore and reports to the Head of IT – Asia.
Key Responsibilities
Provide end user support for day to day PC usage (both applications and infrastructure)
Serve as a point of contact for internal users seeking technical assistance over the support ticketing system with regards to Infrastructure and Network related issues
Ensure operational and change processes and architecture principles are being followed strictly
Assist on projects ensuring the transition from project to BAU support, identifying operational support requirements for new systems/system changes, identify required resources for projects/change requests and ensure consistency in the way IT changes are executed
May be required to work after hours and weekends on an ad hoc basis depending on business requirements
Qualifications, Skills and Experience
Minimum Diploma/Tertiary or professional qualification in Information Technology/Computer Science
Minimum 2-3 years relevant experience in Microsoft Windows Desktops, Servers and Networking and Virtualisation technologies
As this role may at times work closely with our team in greater China, experience working within this region and having the appropriate language skills will be very beneficial.
Previous experience working with Microsoft 365, Cloud and Virtualisation technology would be ideal.
Must be comfortable working in a team-based environment as well as being able to work independently.
Demonstrated collaborative working style, with good interpersonal and excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience in IT operational processes, Help Desk processes and Infrastructure maintenance
Knowledge in IT Security and working in a regional role would be advantageous.
How to apply
Take the next step in your career and apply now by clicking on the link below to submit a cover letter and your resume.
Only Shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
My client, an IT service management company is looking to hire IT specialist (Infrastructure) to join the IT team under the Corporate solution department.The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of IT infrastructure and how to operate and maintain it.

Role
People Management: Train and brief user/department IT promoters on security best practices. Organize and manage team members.
IT Assets Management: Manage IT assets, including hardware, software, and licenses.
System Management: Manage internal IT systems, including servers, networks, and applications.
System Enhancement: Improve and enhance the system environment, including performance, security, and compliance.
System Security: Enhance system security with compliance standards.
Troubleshooting: Support department IT promoters in troubleshooting system/equipment problems (PC, server, network).
Policy Planning: Plan and define security and maintenance policies.
Requirements
Degree from any recognized university
Experience:
At least 4 years of working experience in system construction and internal IT
Experience in infrastructure operation and maintenance
Experience in organizing and maintaining operation rules and conditions
Have experience with cloud services, Office applications, and Windows Server OS.
Programming skills and experience with application development are also nice to have.
Knowledge:
Cloud services (AWS, Azure)
Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Windows Server OS
Microsoft 365 (Microsoft Admin Center, Intune)
Skills:
Active Directory
Backup tools (Veeam, BackupExec)
Networking (SSL-VPN, firewalls)
Application development
Programming skills (PowerShell, shell scripts, VBS/VBA, Python)
Microsoft 365
